info.name: Gooclaim FHIR Scopes ‚Äì Intake, Coding, Denial & Utility
info.description:
# Gooclaim FHIR API Collection

## Setup Instructions

### 1. Set Collection Variables

- **fhir_base_url**: Your Epic FHIR base URL (e.g., `https://fhir.epic.com/interconnect-fhir-oauth/api/FHIR/R4/`)
- **access_token**: Your OAuth2 bearer token (without "Bearer " prefix)

### 2. Required Scopes

This collection requires the following Epic FHIR scopes:

- `system/Patient.read`
- `system/Coverage.read`
- `system/Encounter.read`
- `system/Appointment.read`
- `system/Contract.read`
- `system/Consent.read`
- `system/DocumentReference.read`
- `system/Condition.read`
- `system/Procedure.read`
- `system/Observation.read`
- `system/Binary.read`
- `system/Organization.read`
- `system/Practitioner.read`
- `system/ExplanationOfBenefit.read`
- `system/PractitionerRole.read`
- `system/Provenance.read`

### 3. Security & Compliance

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important**: This collection handles Protected Health Information (PHI) and Personally Identifiable Information (PII).

- Ensure all requests are made over HTTPS
- Implement proper audit logging for all API calls
- Follow HIPAA compliance requirements
- Never commit tokens or sensitive data to version control
- Rotate access tokens regularly
- Use secure token storage mechanisms in production

item.name: GET Observation Search by Patient (Vital Signs)

request.description:
**Purpose**: Vitals, labs, findings
**Required Scope**: system/Observation.read

**Purpose**: PDFs/attachments (notes, radiology, labs)
**Required Scope**: system/Binary.read

Note: For raw content, some servers require `Accept: application/pdf` header or query parameter `?format=application/pdf`. For versioned access, use `{{fhir_base_url}}Binary/{{binary_id}}/_history/{{vid}}`

**Purpose**: PDFs/attachments (notes, radiology, labs)
**Required Scope**: system/Binary.read

Fetches raw binary content with PDF content type. Alternative: Use `{{fhir_base_url}}Binary/{{binary_id}}/_history/{{vid}}` for versioned access.
